intro: Jurinea albovii, commonly known as the white-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to store water in its arid environment. Jurinea albovii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
